definition[0]: downscale goods or services are cheap and not of very good quality
definition[1]: to sell or buy cheaper goods of lower quality
example[0]: She predicts that American consumers will downscale in reaction to the recession.
example[1]: Other organisations will downscale their programs, sell more t-shirts and work for other sources of revenue.
definition[2]: involving goods and services that are cheap and not very good quality compared to similar goods or services
definition[3]: to start buying or selling cheaper goods or services
example[3]: Companies with strong middle-class brand names found that it was virtually impossible to move upscale or downscale, and consequently they were in deep trouble.
definition[4]: to change a product or a service, or peopleâ€™s ideas about it, so that it is cheaper or seems cheaper and more popular
example[4]: He opened 60 more stores and took the chain downscale.
